result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan J.J. Stetler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is sentenced to time served.
Expungment will be granted if restitution is paid in full

records.addlTxt: Initial Appearance, Bail/Bond Hearing held on January 4, 2016

ADDRESS INFO for Ryan J.J. Stetler
Current: 305 S Wasson Ln, River Falls, WI 54022 United States  (Effective: 03-13-2017)
Prior: 1439 - 109th St., New Richmond, WI 54017
from Atty Mangelson re: agreement on case, agree to cancel trial and schedule plea/sentencing/restitution hearing at  FPT 9/26. Requests to appear via phone. DA Froelich has no objection.

04:05 14CM101 also heard at this time. Defendant Ryan J.J. Stetler in court with attorney Heidi J. Mangelsen.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich files amended complaints for both cases, defendant to plead to count 1 in 14CM101 and count 1 in 16CM1, time served, requests restitution in 14CM101 which is set for rest. hearing next week, defendant may apply for expungment in both cases.  Atty Mangelsen agrees.    Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant.   Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.   DEF PLEADS GUILTY to count 1 of amended complaint in 14CM101 and to count 1 of amended complaint in 16CM1.   Facts are correct.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEAS, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.   The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty in count 1 of amended complaint in 14CM101 and guilty of count 1 of amended complaint in 16CM1.  Court orders: time served in both cases, required to pay restitution that will be determined next week, both cases may be expunged if restitution is paid.   Appeal rights are given to the defendant. 04:22

Plea hearing at 03-09-2016 03:30 pm.
Restitution hearing at 03-15-2016 03:00 pm.

Plea hearing at 03-09-2016 09:00 am.
Restitution hearing at 03-15-2016 03:00 pm.

Bond conditions read to the Defendant by the Court Commissioner.

3:38 Defendant Ryan J.J. Stetler in court  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ, in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Christopher Bub appeared in court.   Defendant has copy of complaint.  Court reads charges and possible penalties.  Defendant waives reading of the complaint.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas not guilty. Court rec/enter. Froelich: $2000 signature bond and absolute sobriety. Bub has no objection to signature bond.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 04:15 pm.
